## Critical Reception of "The Hobbit" in Poland

Czesław Miłosz wrote about "Hobbit: bohater XX w." (The Hobbit: Hero of the 20th Century) in Tygodnik Powszechny in 2002, issue 8. This indicates that the renowned Polish poet and Nobel laureate engaged with Tolkien's work in one of Poland's most prestigious Catholic weekly magazines.

Polish studies and essays about Tolkien were compiled in a volume covering the years 1965-1994, presenting various ways of reading Tolkien's work. The volume was divided into three parts, defining three main currents of Polish research on Tolkien's works.

"The Hobbit: The Battle of Five Armies," the last part of the film adaptation of J.R.R. Tolkien's saga that hit theaters, is essentially a war film - a struggle between good and evil, where good will win, though temporarily. This review from Tygodnik Powszechny discusses the film adaptations of Tolkien's work.

### Academic Reception

Research on the reception of "The Hobbit" in Poland among contemporary teenagers has been conducted, examining the book as a carrier of values in Polish language education, specifically discussing J.R.R. Tolkien's fantasy novel "The Hobbit, or There and Back Again" from an axiological perspective.

There has been a Polish discussion about fantasy literature from 1990-2002, which likely included analysis of Tolkien's works and their impact on Polish literary culture.

The Polish reception includes various interpretations of the novel and Middle-earth mythology, ranging from literary studies to depth psychology, from the etymology of the word "Hobbit" to the role of maps in Tolkien's work. Interestingly, one of the authors suggested that the novel would not be adapted for film (the book was published in 1996).

While the search results provide some insights into Polish critical reception of Tolkien's work, including the notable review by Czesław Miłosz in Tygodnik Powszechny, specific detailed reviews from Polityka magazine were not found in these results. The reception appears to have been multifaceted, encompassing academic studies, educational perspectives, and cultural criticism across several decades.
